verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, See, I have made thee a god to Pharaoh: and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Behold, I have made you as God to Pharaoh; and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "I have made you like God to Pharaoh, and your brother Aaron will serve as your prophet.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he send the children of Israel out of his land.
verses.web: You shall speak all that I command you; and Aaron your brother shall speak to Pharaoh, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.ct: You will tell Aaron everything I command you, and he will speak to Pharaoh, demanding that he let the people of Israel leave his land."

verses.kjv: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
verses.web: I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: "But I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and I will multiply my signs and wonders throughout Egypt.

verses.kjv: But Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that I may lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth mine armies, and my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
verses.web: But Pharaoh will not listen to you, so I will lay my hand on Egypt, and bring out my armies, my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
verses.ct: Pharaoh won't listen to you. So I will bring my power down on Egypt and lead my armies — my people, the children of Israel — out of that land through mighty acts of judgment.

verses.kjv: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch forth mine hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
verses.web: The Egyptians shall know that I am LORD when I stretch out my hand on Egypt, and bring the children of Israel out from among them.”
verses.ct: The Egyptians will know that I am the LORD when I stretch out my hand against Egypt and bring the people of Israel out from among them."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron did as the LORD commanded them, so did they.
verses.web: Moses and Aaron did so. As LORD commanded them, so they did.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron did exactly what the LORD commanded them.

verses.kjv: And Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spake unto Pharaoh.
verses.web: Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty-three years old, when they spoke to Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Moses was 80 years old and Aaron was 83 when they confronted Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, Shew a miracle for you: then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it before Pharaoh, and it shall become a serpent.
verses.web: “When Pharaoh speaks to you, saying, ‘Perform a miracle!’ then you shall tell Aaron, ‘Take your rod, and cast it down before Pharaoh, and it will become a serpent.’ ”
verses.ct: "When Pharaoh demands, 'Prove yourselves with a miracle,' tell Aaron to take his staff and throw it down in front of Pharaoh. It will turn into a serpent."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so as the LORD had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh, and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
verses.web: Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and they did so, as LORD had commanded. Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and did exactly what the LORD had commanded. Aaron threw his staff down in front of Pharaoh and his officials, and it turned into a serpent.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers: now the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
verses.web: Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers. They also, the magicians of Egypt, did the same thing with their enchantments.
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned his wise men and sorcerers, and the magicians of Egypt did the same thing using their dark arts.

verses.kjv: For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
verses.web: For they each cast down their rods, and they became serpents; but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
verses.ct: Each of them threw down his staff, and their staffs also became serpents. But Aaron's staff swallowed up every one of theirs.

verses.kjv: And he hardened Pharaoh’s heart, that he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.web: Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he didn’t listen to them, as LORD had spoken.
verses.ct: Still, Pharaoh's heart grew hard, and he refused to listen to them — just as the LORD had said.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart is hardened, he refuseth to let the people go.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is stubborn. He refuses to let the people go.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Moses, "Pharaoh's heart is stubborn. He refuses to let the people go.

verses.kjv: Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river’s brink against he come; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand.
verses.web: Go to Pharaoh in the morning. Behold, he is going out to the water. You shall stand by the river’s bank to meet him. You shall take the rod which was turned to a serpent in your hand.
verses.ct: Go to Pharaoh in the morning — he'll be heading down to the water. Wait for him on the bank of the Nile, and take with you the staff that turned into a serpent.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.
verses.web: You shall tell him, ‘LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to you, saying, “Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness. Behold, until now you haven’t listened.”
verses.ct: Tell him, 'The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, sent me to you with this message: Let my people go so they can worship me in the wilderness. But so far, you have refused to listen.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, In this thou shalt know that I am the LORD: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
verses.web: LORD says, “In this you shall know that I am LORD. Behold: I will strike with the rod that is in my hand on the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
verses.ct: 'This is what the LORD says: By this you will know that I am the LORD. Watch — I am about to strike the water of the Nile with this staff, and it will turn to blood.

verses.kjv: And the fish that is in the river shall die, and the river shall stink; and the Egyptians shall lothe to drink of the water of the river.
verses.web: The fish that are in the river will die and the river will become foul. The Egyptians will loathe to drink water from the river.” ’ ”
verses.ct: The fish in the river will die, the river will reek, and the Egyptians won't be able to stomach drinking from it.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thine hand upon the waters of Egypt, upon their streams, upon their rivers, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pools of water, that they may become blood; and that there may be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and in vessels of stone.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Take your rod, and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams, and over their pools, and over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood. There will be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Say to Aaron, 'Take your staff and stretch your hand out over every body of water in Egypt — over the rivers, the streams, the ponds, and every pool — and they will all turn to blood. There will be blood throughout the entire land of Egypt, even in their wooden buckets and stone jars.'"

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
verses.web: Moses and Aaron did so, as LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and struck the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron did exactly what the LORD commanded. Aaron raised the staff and struck the water of the Nile right in front of Pharaoh and his officials, and every drop of water in the river turned to blood.

verses.kjv: And the fish that was in the river died; and the river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river; and there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.web: The fish that were in the river died. The river became foul. The Egyptians couldn’t drink water from the river. The blood was throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The fish in the river died, the stench was unbearable, and the Egyptians couldn't drink from the Nile. Blood was everywhere throughout the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, neither did he hearken unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.web: The magicians of Egypt did the same thing with their enchantments. So Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he didn’t listen to them, as LORD had spoken.
verses.ct: But Egypt's magicians did the same thing with their dark arts, so Pharaoh's heart grew even harder. He refused to listen to Moses and Aaron — just as the LORD had said.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he set his heart to this also.
verses.web: Pharaoh turned and went into his house, and he didn’t even take this to heart.
verses.ct: Pharaoh simply turned around and went back into his palace. He didn't give it a second thought.

verses.kjv: And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
verses.web: All the Egyptians dug around the river for water to drink; for they couldn’t drink the river water.
verses.ct: All the Egyptians had to dig along the riverbanks to find drinkable water, because the river itself was undrinkable.

verses.kjv: And seven days were fulfilled, after that the LORD had smitten the river.
verses.web: Seven days were fulfilled, after LORD had struck the river.
verses.ct: 7 full days passed after the LORD struck the Nile.
